meta.description: Complete Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT) skills library mapped to tarot archetypes
meta.source: Linehan's DBT Skills Training Manual, evidence-based practices

dbt_core_principle.explanation: DBT balances accepting yourself as you are RIGHT NOW with working to change for the better. This is the Middle Way. Both are true.
dbt_core_principle.integration: Temperance literally depicts the blending of opposites - one foot in water (emotion), one on land (logic). This IS wise mind.

module_1_mindfulness.name: Mindfulness
module_1_mindfulness.description: Core skill underlying all DBT. Being present, aware, non-judgmental.
module_1_mindfulness.goal: Achieve Wise Mind (balance of Emotion Mind + Reasonable Mind)

reasonable_mind.description: Logical, analytical, problem-solving mode. Cold facts.
reasonable_mind.when_helpful: Making big decisions, solving complex problems

emotion_mind.description: Feelings drive thoughts and actions. Hot emotions.
emotion_mind.example: Crying at sad movie, impulsive anger, passionate love

wise_mind.description: Integration of Reasonable + Emotion. Intuitive knowing.
wise_mind.example: You KNOW the right answer, combining logic and feeling
wise_mind.power: Makes decisions you won't regret later
wise_mind.how_to_access: Ask: 'What do I deeply know is right?' Feel it in your gut + think it through your head.

observe.description: Notice without reacting. Just watch your thoughts/feelings/sensations.
observe.how: Step back. Witness like you're watching a movie of yourself.
observe.practice: Notice 5 things you see. Don't judge, just observe.
observe.app_prompt: Take 3 breaths. What sensations do you notice in your body right now?

describe.description: Put words to what you observe. Stick to facts, not interpretations.
describe.how: Use objective language. 'My chest is tight' not 'I'm having a panic attack.'
describe.practice: Describe your current emotion as a color, temperature, texture.
describe.app_prompt: If this emotion were a weather pattern, how would you describe it?

participate.description: Fully engage in the present moment. Become one with your activity.
participate.how: Throw yourself in. Lose self-consciousness. Flow state.
participate.practice: Do ONE thing mindfully today - washing dishes, walking, eating.
participate.app_prompt: What activity helps you lose track of time? How can you do more of that?

non_judgmentally.description: Let go of evaluations (good/bad, right/wrong). Just observe what IS.
non_judgmentally.how: Notice judgments arise ('this is stupid'). Acknowledge them. Return to facts.
non_judgmentally.practice: Catch 3 judgments today. Replace 'good/bad' with factual description.
non_judgmentally.app_prompt: What judgment are you holding about yourself? Can you observe it without believing it?

one_mindfully.description: Do one thing at a time. Full attention, no multitasking.
one_mindfully.how: When eating, just eat. When walking, just walk. When worried, just worry (then move on).
one_mindfully.practice: Eat one meal today without phone/TV/reading. Just taste.
one_mindfully.app_prompt: What's stealing your attention right now? Can you gently return to THIS moment?

effectively.description: Do what WORKS. Let go of being 'right.' Focus on your goals.
effectively.how: Ask: 'Will this help me reach my goal?' Not: 'Am I right or are they wrong?'
effectively.practice: In one conflict today, choose effectiveness over being right.
effectively.app_prompt: What's your actual goal here? What action moves you toward it?

mindfulness_practices_mapped_to_cards.practice: One-pointed focus meditation (stare at candle flame for 5 min)
Intuitive journaling (write without thinking, let Wise Mind speak)
Silent observation walk (notice environment, no music/podcast)

module_2_distress_tolerance.name: Distress Tolerance
module_2_distress_tolerance.description: Surviving crisis without making it worse. Accepting painful reality.
module_2_distress_tolerance.goal: Get through intense emotions without destructive behaviors

crisis_survival_skills.name: Crisis Survival (When you're overwhelmed RIGHT NOW)

tipp.name: Temperature, Intense exercise, Paced breathing, Paired muscle relaxation
tipp.when: Emotion intensity 8-10/10. You're about to do something destructive.

t_temperature.how: Splash ice-cold water on face, hold ice cube, cold shower
t_temperature.why: Activates dive reflex, slows heart rate, calms nervous system
t_temperature.app_prompt: Emotion too hot? Try cold water on your face for 30 seconds.

i_intense_exercise.how: Run, jump, do burpees, anything vigorous for 10-20 min
i_intense_exercise.app_prompt: Move your body intensely for 60 seconds. Match the emotion's intensity.

p_paced_breathing.how: Breathe in for 4, hold for 4, out for 6. Repeat.
p_paced_breathing.why: Longer exhale activates parasympathetic (calm) nervous system
p_paced_breathing.app_prompt: Box breathing: In-2-3-4, Hold-2-3-4, Out-2-3-4-5-6, Hold-2-3-4

p_paired_muscle.how: Tense muscle for 10 sec, release. Progressive through body.
p_paired_muscle.why: Releases physical tension, grounds you in body
p_paired_muscle.app_prompt: Squeeze fists tight for 10 seconds. Release. Feel the difference.

accepts.name: Activities, Contributing, Comparisons, Emotions, Pushing away, Thoughts, Sensations
accepts.when: Need distraction from painful emotions (short-term relief)

skills.description: Do something engaging to occupy your mind
Help someone else, volunteer, be of service
Compare to times you coped well or when things were worse
examples: I've survived 100% of my worst days so far

skills.description: Watch/read something that creates opposite emotion
examples: Sad? Watch comedy. Angry? Listen to calm music

skills.description: Mentally put the problem in a box to deal with later
Occupy your mind with neutral thoughts
Create strong physical sensations to shift focus

examples: Look at photos of loved ones

radical_acceptance.definition: Completely accepting reality as it is, without fighting it
radical_acceptance.not: Approving, liking, or giving up on change
radical_acceptance.is: Acknowledging what is TRUE right now
how: Notice you're fighting reality ('This shouldn't be happening')
Remind yourself: 'This is the reality right now'
Relax your body (fighting shows up physically)
Acknowledge causes (everything has a cause, even if unfair)
radical_acceptance.app_prompt: What reality are you fighting? Can you say 'This is happening' without 'but it shouldn't'?

turning_the_mind.definition: Making the choice to accept, over and over
turning_the_mind.analogy: Like turning a key. Each time you reject reality, turn the key back to acceptance.
turning_the_mind.practice: When you notice yourself rejecting reality (even subtly), consciously choose: 'I'm turning toward acceptance.'

willingness.definition: Being open to doing what's needed, even if you don't feel like it
willingness.practice: Notice 'I don't want to' vs. 'I'm willing to try.' Choose willingness.
willingness.app_prompt: What are you resisting that might actually help? Can you be willing to try?

module_3_emotion_regulation.name: Emotion Regulation
module_3_emotion_regulation.description: Understanding and managing emotions, reducing vulnerability to negative emotions
module_3_emotion_regulation.goal: Decrease emotional suffering, increase positive experiences

understanding_emotions.function_of_emotions: Emotions are DATA. They communicate information and motivate action.

please_master.name: Physical illness, Eating, Avoid mood-altering drugs, Sleep, Exercise
please_master.description: Reduce vulnerability to negative emotions by taking care of your body

skills.how: See doctor when sick, take meds as prescribed
Regular meals, balanced nutrition, not too much/little
20-30 min most days, anything that moves your body

abc_please.name: Accumulate positive emotions, Build mastery, Cope ahead, PLEASE

accumulate_positive_short_term.how: Do pleasant things daily that fit your values
accumulate_positive_short_term.app_feature: Daily pleasant event tracker with mood correlation

accumulate_positive_long_term.how: Build a life worth living - work toward valued goals

build_mastery.how: Do something challenging that makes you feel competent

how: Identify situation that might be difficult
Plan coping strategies ahead of time
cope_ahead.example: Before difficult conversation: plan DEAR MAN, practice deep breathing, have friend on standby

opposite_action.description: When emotion doesn't fit the facts, act opposite to the emotion's urge
opposite_action.revolutionary: This is the MOST POWERFUL DBT skill for changing emotions
opposite_action.when_to_use: When emotion is NOT JUSTIFIED by facts OR intensity doesn't fit

examples.opposite_action: Share it, hold head high, repeat the behavior (if not harmful)

problem_solving.when: When emotion IS justified (problem exists), solve the problem!
steps: Brainstorm solutions (write down ALL ideas, even bad ones)
Evaluate result (if didn't work, try different solution)
problem_solving.tarot_card: The Magician (using tools to solve problems)

module_4_interpersonal_effectiveness.name: Interpersonal Effectiveness
module_4_interpersonal_effectiveness.description: Getting what you need from relationships while keeping self-respect and the relationship
module_4_interpersonal_effectiveness.goal: Ask effectively, say no effectively, maintain relationships, maintain self-respect

dear_man.name: Describe, Express, Assert, Reinforce, Mindful, Appear confident, Negotiate
dear_man.when: Asking for something or saying no

describe.how: State the FACTS of the situation, no judgments
describe.example: 'You said you'd call at 7pm and didn't' (not 'You're so unreliable!')

express.how: Share your FEELINGS and OPINIONS using 'I' statements
express.example: 'I felt worried when I didn't hear from you'

assert.how: ASK clearly for what you want or SAY NO clearly
assert.example: 'I need you to text if you'll be late' or 'No, I can't do that'

reinforce.how: Explain positive effects of getting what you want
reinforce.example: 'If you text, I won't worry and we'll both be happier'

mindful.how: Don't be distracted. Broken record if needed ('But what about...' → 'I understand, AND I need X')

appear_confident.how: Eye contact, calm tone, confident posture (even if you don't feel it)

negotiate.how: Be willing to compromise. Offer solutions. Ask what they need.
negotiate.example: 'What if we...?' or 'Can we meet in the middle?'

gentle.how: No attacks, threats, or judgments. Kind tone and words.
gentle.not: 'You ALWAYS do this!' or 'You're so selfish!'
gentle.is: 'I've noticed this pattern' or 'I feel hurt'

interested.how: Listen. Ask questions. Show you care about their perspective.
interested.example: 'Tell me more about why that's important to you'

validate.how: Acknowledge their feelings/perspective as understandable (even if you disagree)
validate.example: 'I can see why you'd feel that way' or 'That makes sense given X'
validate.power: Validation de-escalates conflict faster than anything

easy_manner.how: Smile, be light, use humor if appropriate. Don't be grim/heavy.
easy_manner.why: People respond better to pleasant interactions

fast.name: Fair, Apologies (no excessive), Stick to values, Truthful

fair.how: Fair to yourself AND the other person. Not a doormat, not a tyrant.

no_apologies.how: Apologize ONCE for actual wrongdoing. Don't apologize for existing/having needs.
no_apologies.not: 'I'm so sorry to bother you...' (50 times)
no_apologies.is: I need your help with X'

stick_to_values.how: Don't abandon your principles to please someone. Know your non-negotiables.
stick_to_values.example: If honesty is a value, don't lie to avoid conflict

truthful.how: Don't lie, exaggerate, or make excuses. Honesty (with kindness).

integration_with_tarot_major_arcana.7_The_Chariot: Opposite action, moving forward despite emotion
integration_with_tarot_major_arcana.14_Temperance: THE DBT CARD - Wise Mind, balance, dialectics

achievements.name: Wise Mind Warrior
achievements.description: Access Wise Mind 10 times (identify in journal)

achievements.name: TIPP Master
achievements.description: Use all 4 TIPP skills during crisis

achievements.name: Radical Acceptor
achievements.description: Practice radical acceptance 7 days in a row

achievements.name: Opposite Action Hero
achievements.description: Act opposite to emotion and track mood change
